title: Trans-Adriatic Bio-Physical Monitoring and Retrospective Analysis Pilot Project
abstract: The relations between physical parameters, and marine organisms, due to changes of climate in the marine environment are documented, but yet it remains impossible to forecast the trends in the marine ecosystem, for the reason of interrelations of the feedback nature, and phenomena due to anthropogenic impact. With this study it is proposed the pilot project for the distinguishing the parameters and processes that could be useful for the monitoring activity of the marine environment. The project consists of interdisciplinary study for evaluating the changes introduced from different climatic impacts at the physical properties of the marine ecosystem.

motivations: Changes in climate and anthropogenic impacts are affecting marine ecosystems, but forecasting trends remains challenging due to complex interrelations and feedback phenomena.
There is a need to identify key parameters and processes for effective monitoring of the marine environment.
objectives: Distinguish parameters and processes useful for monitoring the marine environment.
Evaluate changes in the marine ecosystem introduced by different climatic impacts on physical properties.
methods: Conduct an interdisciplinary study to assess the impact of climate changes on the marine ecosystem.
results: Improve understanding of the relationships between physical parameters, marine organisms, and climate changes.
Enhance the ability to forecast trends in the marine ecosystem.
llama_json.research_subject: Bio-physical monitoring and analysis of the marine ecosystem in response to climate changes

motivations: Understanding the relationship between physical parameters and marine organisms in the context of climate change is challenging due to complex feedback interrelations and anthropogenic impacts.
There is a need for effective monitoring of marine environments to identify and understand the impacts of different climatic factors.
objectives: Distinguish parameters and processes useful for monitoring the marine environment.
Evaluate the changes introduced by different climatic impacts on the physical properties of the marine ecosystem.
methods: Conduct an interdisciplinary study to evaluate the impacts of different climatic factors on the marine ecosystem.
results: Identify key parameters and processes for effective monitoring of marine environments.
Provide insights into the impacts of climate change on the physical properties of marine ecosystems.
openai_json.research_subject: Bio-physical monitoring and retrospective analysis of marine ecosystems in the Adriatic

motivations: The complex interrelations between physical parameters and marine organisms make it impossible to forecast trends in marine ecosystems despite documented climate change impacts.
There is a need to identify key parameters and processes for effective monitoring of marine environments under changing climatic conditions and anthropogenic impacts.
objectives: Establish a pilot project to identify parameters and processes suitable for marine environment monitoring activities.
Evaluate changes in the physical properties of marine ecosystems resulting from different climatic impacts through interdisciplinary study.
methods: Conduct interdisciplinary studies integrating physical and biological monitoring across the Trans-Adriatic region.
Perform retrospective analysis of marine ecosystem data to identify climate-induced changes.
results: Identification of key parameters and processes for effective marine environment monitoring.
Enhanced understanding of how climatic impacts affect the physical properties of marine ecosystems.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Bio-physical monitoring and climate impact assessment in Trans-Adriatic marine ecosystems
